intro: Andreoskia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, often yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plants typically have hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and they are native to regions in Europe and western Asia. Andreoskia species are often found in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. They are popular in gardens for their vibrant colors and ornamental value.
